protocol.description:
remote_shell allows clients to turn a wl_surface into a "real window" which can be stacked and activated by the user.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

interface.name: zcr_remote_shell_v1
interface.description: The global interface that allows clients to turn a wl_surface into a "real window" which is remotely managed but can be stacked, activated and made fullscreen by the user.

enum.name: container
enum.description: Determine how a remote surface should be stacked relative to other shell surfaces.

enum.name: state_type
enum.description: Defines common show states for shell surfaces.

enum.name: layout_mode
enum.description: Determine how a client should layout surfaces.

request.name: destroy
request.description:
Destroy this remote_shell object.
Destroying a bound remote_shell object while there are surfaces still alive created by this remote_shell object instance is illegal and will result in a protocol error.

request.name: get_remote_surface

description.summary: create a remote shell surface from a surface

request.description:
This creates an remote_surface for the given surface and gives it the remote_surface role. A wl_surface can only be given a remote_surface role once. If get_remote_surface is called with a wl_surface that already has an active remote_surface associated with it, or if it had any other role, an error is raised.
See the documentation of remote_surface for more details about what an remote_surface is and how it is used.

event.name: activated
event.description: Notifies client that the activated surface changed.

request.name: get_notification_surface

description.summary: create a notification surface from a surface

request.description: Creates a notification_surface for the given surface, gives it the notification_surface role and associated it with a notification id.

event.name: configuration_changed

description.summary: suggests a re-configuration of remote shell

event.description: [Deprecated] Suggests a re-configuration of remote shell.

event.name: workspace
event.description: Defines an area of the remote shell used for layout. Each series of "workspace" events must be terminated by a "configure" event.

event.name: configure
event.description: Suggests a new configuration of the remote shell. Preceded by a series of "workspace" events.

event.name: default_device_scale_factor
event.description: Sends the default device scale factor.

arg.name: scale
arg.summary: DP to pixels ratio, in 8.24 fixed point format

interface.name: zcr_remote_surface_v1
interface.description:
An interface that may be implemented by a wl_surface, for implementations that provide a desktop-style user interface and allows for remotely managed windows.
It provides requests to treat surfaces like windows, allowing to set properties like app id and geometry.
The client must call wl_surface.commit on the corresponding wl_surface for the remote_surface state to take effect.
For a surface to be mapped by the compositor the client must have committed both an remote_surface state and a buffer.

enum.name: systemui_visibility_state
enum.description: Determine the visibility behavior of the system UI.

entry.name: autohide_non_sticky
entry.summary: system ui autohides and is not sticky

entry.name: autohide_sticky
entry.summary: system ui autohides and is sticky

request.name: destroy
request.description: Unmap and destroy the window. The window will be effectively hidden from the user's point of view, and all state will be lost.

request.name: set_app_id
request.description: Set an application identifier for the surface.

request.name: set_window_geometry
request.description:
The window geometry of a window is its "visible bounds" from the user's perspective. Client-side decorations often have invisible portions like drop-shadows which should be ignored for the purposes of aligning, placing and constraining windows.
The window geometry is double buffered, and will be applied at the time wl_surface.commit of the corresponding wl_surface is called.
Once the window geometry of the surface is set once, it is not possible to unset it, and it will remain the same until set_window_geometry is called again, even if a new subsurface or buffer is attached.
If never set, the value is the full bounds of the output. This updates dynamically on every commit.
The arguments are given in the output coordinate space.
The width and height must be greater than zero.

request.name: set_scale
request.description: Set a scale factor that will be applied to surface and all descendants.

request.name: set_rectangular_shadow
request.description:
[Deprecated] Request that surface needs a rectangular shadow.
This is only a request that the surface should have a rectangular shadow. The compositor may choose to ignore this request.
The arguments are given in the output coordinate space and specifies the inner bounds of the shadow.
The arguments are given in the output coordinate space. Specifying zero width and height will disable the shadow.

request.name: set_rectangular_shadow_background_opacity
request.description: [Deprecated] Suggests the window's background opacity when the shadow is requested.

request.name: set_title
request.description:
Set a short title for the surface.
This string may be used to identify the surface in a task bar, window list, or other user interface elements provided by the compositor.
The string must be encoded in UTF-8.

request.name: set_top_inset
request.description:
Set distance from the top of the surface to the contents.
This distance typically represents the size of the window caption.

request.name: activate
request.description: Make the surface active and bring it to the front.

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: the serial of the user event

request.name: maximize
request.description:
Request that surface is maximized. The window geometry will be updated to whatever the compositor finds appropriate for a maximized window.
This is only a request that the window should be maximized. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to set_maximized events to determine if the window was maximized or not.

request.name: minimize
request.description:
Request that surface is minimized.
This is only a request that the window should be minimized. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to set_minimized events to determine if the window was minimized or not.

request.name: restore
request.description:
Request that surface is restored. This restores the window geometry to what it was before the window was minimized, maximized or made fullscreen.
This is only a request that the window should be restored. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to unset_maximized, unset_minimize and unset_fullscreen events to determine if the window was restored or not.

request.name: fullscreen
request.description:
Request that surface is made fullscreen.
This is only a request that the window should be made fullscreen. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to set_fullscreen events to determine if the window was made fullscreen or not.

request.name: unfullscreen
request.description:
Request that surface is made unfullscreen.
This is only a request that the window should be made unfullscreen. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to unset_fullscreen events to determine if the window was made unfullscreen or not.

request.name: pin
request.description:
Request that surface is pinned.
This is only a request that the window should be pinned. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to state_changed events to determine if the window was pinned or not. If trusted flag is non-zero, the app can prevent users from exiting the pinned mode.

request.name: unpin
request.description:
Request that surface is unpinned.
This is only a request that the window should be unpinned. The compositor may choose to ignore this request. The client should listen to unset_pinned events to determine if the window was unpinned or not.

request.name: set_system_modal

description.summary: suggests a re-layout of remote shell input area

request.description: Suggests a surface should become system modal.

request.name: unset_system_modal

description.summary: suggests a re-layout of remote shell input area

request.description: Suggests a surface should become non system modal.

event.name: close
event.description:
The close event is sent by the compositor when the user wants the surface to be closed. This should be equivalent to the user clicking the close button in client-side decorations, if your application has any...
This is only a request that the user intends to close your window. The client may choose to ignore this request, or show a dialog to ask the user to save their data...

event.name: state_type_changed
event.description:
[Deprecated] The state_type_changed event is sent by the compositor when the surface state changed.
This is an event to notify that the window state changed in compositor. The state change may be triggered by a client's request, or some user action directly handled by the compositor. The client may choose to ignore this event.

request.name: set_rectangular_surface_shadow
request.description:
Request that surface needs a rectangular shadow.
This is only a request that the surface should have a rectangular shadow. The compositor may choose to ignore this request.
The arguments are given in the remote surface coordinate space and specifies inner bounds of the shadow. Specifying zero width and height will disable the shadow.

request.name: set_systemui_visibility

description.summary: requests the system ui visibility behavior for the surface

request.description: Requests how the surface will change the visibility of the system UI when it is made active.

request.name: set_always_on_top
request.description:
Request that surface is made to be always on top.
This is only a request that the window should be always on top. The compositor may choose to ignore this request.

request.name: unset_always_on_top
request.description:
Request that surface is made to be not always on top.
This is only a request that the window should be not always on top. The compositor may choose to ignore this request.

event.name: configure
event.description:
The configure event asks the client to change surface state.
The client must apply the origin offset to window positions in set_window_geometry requests.
The states listed in the event are state_type values, and might change due to a client request or an event directly handled by the compositor.
Clients should arrange their surface for the new state, and then send an ack_configure request with the serial sent in this configure event at some point before committing the new surface.
If the client receives multiple configure events before it can respond to one, it is free to discard all but the last event it received.

request.name: ack_configure
request.description:
When a configure event is received, if a client commits the surface in response to the configure event, then the client must make an ack_configure request sometime before the commit request, passing along the serial of the configure event.
For instance, the compositor might use this information during display configuration to change its coordinate space for set_window_geometry requests only when the client has switched to the new coordinate space.
If the client receives multiple configure events before it can respond to one, it only has to ack the last configure event.
A client is not required to commit immediately after sending an ack_configure request - it may even ack_configure several times before its next surface commit.
A client may send multiple ack_configure requests before committing, but only the last request sent before a commit indicates which configure event the client really is responding to.

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: the serial from the configure event

request.name: move
request.description:
Start an interactive, user-driven move of the surface.
The compositor responds to this request with a configure event that transitions to the "moving" state. The client must only initiate motion after acknowledging the state change. The compositor can assume that subsequent set_window_geometry requests are position updates until the next state transition is acknowledged.
The compositor may ignore move requests depending on the state of the surface, e.g. fullscreen or maximized.

request.name: set_orientation
request.description: Set an orientation for the surface.

request.name: set_window_type

description.summary: set the type of the window

request.description: Set the type of window. This is only a hint to the compositor and the compositor is free to ignore it.

request.name: resize
request.description:
[Deprecated] Start an interactive, user-driven resize of the surface.
The compositor responds to this request with a configure event that transitions to the "resizing" state. The client must only initiate resizing after acknowledging the state change. The compositor can assume that subsequent set_window_geometry requests are resizes until the next state transition is acknowledged.
The compositor may ignore resize requests depending on the state of the surface, e.g. fullscreen or maximized.

request.name: set_resize_outset
request.description:
Expand input region of surface with resize outset.
The compositor clips the input region of each surface to its bounds, unless the client requests a resize outset. In that case, the input region of the root surface is expanded to allow for some leeway around visible bounds when starting a user-driven resize.

event.name: window_geometry_changed
event.description:
Notify the client of committed window geometry.
The compositor sends this event when it commits window geometry. The client may use this information to convert coordinates of input events using the latest committed geometry.

enum.name: bounds_change_reason
enum.description: Specifies the cause of the window bounds change event.

entry.name: drag_move
entry.summary: the window is being moved by drag operation

entry.name: drag_resize
entry.summary: the window is being resized by drag operation.

entry.name: snap_to_left
entry.summary: the window is resized to left snapped state

entry.name: snap_to_right
entry.summary: the window is resized to right snapped state

entry.name: move
entry.summary: the window bounds is moved due to other WM operations

entry.name: resize
entry.summary: the window bounds is reiszed due to other WM operations

event.name: bounds_changed

description.summary: The compositor requested to change the bounds

event.description:
The compositor requested to change its bounds. "bounds_change_reason" specifies the cause of the bounds change. The client may apply the different move/resize strategy depending on the reason.
"display_id_hi", "display_id_lo" specifies in which workspace the surface should live in.
The client responds with set_window_geometry request, with the bounds it is resized to (this may be different from the bounds requested).
The client may ignore move request depending on the state, e.g, if it becomes resizable or other constrants.

request.name: start_move
request.description:
Request an interactive, user-driven move of the surface. "x" and "y" specifies the starting point of the pointer device that initiated the move.
The compositor responds to this request with a drag_started event with "none" direction. Please see drag_started event for more details.
The compositor may ignore move requests depending on the state of the surface, e.g. fullscreen or maximized.

enum.name: resize_direction
enum.description: The resize direction for drag operation

event.name: drag_started

description.summary: Notifies that a drag to move/resize started.

event.description:
Notifies a client that the compositor started drag operation. "direction" specifies which direction it is being resized. "none" direction means just move but not resize.
This will be followed by series of the "bounds_changed" event with "drag_resize" or "drag_move" reasons to update the window bounds druing the drag operation.

event.name: drag_finished

description.summary: Notifies that a drag operation has finished.

event.description: Called when the drag operation is finished. "x" and "y" specifies the position of the pointer device used to drag. "canceled" is true if the drag operation is aborted during drag (e.g. by capture change or user action.)

arg.name: canceled
arg.summary: true if the operation was canceled

request.name: set_can_maximize
request.description: Request that surface can be in maximzied state.

request.name: unset_can_maximize
request.description: Request that surface can not be in maximzied state.

request.name: set_min_size
request.description:
Set a minimum size of the surface.
Values set in this way are double-buffered. They will get applied on the next commit.

request.name: set_max_size
request.description:
Set a maximum size of the surface.
Values set in this way are double-buffered. They will get applied on the next commit.
Setting the same size as minimum size makes the surface unresizable.

request.name: set_snapped_to_left

description.summary: set the surface to left snapped

request.description: Request that surface is snapped to left.

request.name: set_snapped_to_right

description.summary: set the surface to right snapped

request.description: Request that surface is snapped to right.

request.name: start_resize
request.description:
Request to start an interactive, user-driven resize of the surface. "x" and "y" specifies the starting point of the pointer device that initiated the reize.
The compositor responds to this request with a "drag_started" event, followed by "bounds_changed" events, and ends the resize operation with a "drag_finhsed" event. The compositor determines the new bounds using the resize_direction and the pointer event location.
The compositor may ignore resize requests depending on the state of the surface, e.g. fullscreen or maximized, or no drag event is in pregress.

enum.name: frame_type
enum.description: Frame type that can be used to decorate a surface.

request.name: set_frame
request.description: Enables compositor side frame decoration. |type| specifies the type of frame to use for the surface.

enum.name: frame_button_type
enum.description: The mask that represents buttons on frame.

entry.name: minimize
entry.summary: a button to minimize the window

entry.name: maximize_restore
entry.summary: a button to maximize or restore

entry.name: menu
entry.summary: a button to activate application's menu

entry.name: close
entry.summary: a button to close the window

entry.name: zoom
entry.summary: a mask to turn the maximize_restore button to zoom button

request.name: set_frame_buttons
request.description:
Updates the frame's button state. |visible_buttons| and |enabled_buttons| are the union of button mask defined in |frame_button_type| enum.
The mask present in |enabled_buttons| but not in |visible_buttons| will be ignored.

request.name: set_extra_title
request.description:
The extra informational string about the surface. This can be used to show the debug information in the title bar, or log messages.
This is different from "set_title" which is used to identify the surface.
The string must be encoded in UTF-8.

enum.name: orientation_lock

description.summary: orientation lock request for remote surfaces

enum.description: Defines orientation request when a remote surface is in foreground.

request.name: set_orientation_lock

description.summary: set orientation lock for a remote surface

request.description: Request a specific orientation behavior when this surface is in foreground.

request.name: pip

description.summary: set pip for a remote surface

request.description: Request that surface is set to Picture-in-Picture (PIP).

interface.name: zcr_notification_surface_v1
interface.description: An interface that may be implemented by a wl_surface to host notification contents.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Unmap and destroy the notification surface.

request.name: set_app_id
request.description: Set an application identifier for the notification surface.
